flawed_nl_solution:
Mark has 10 fewer cards than Michael so Mark has 100 cards - 10 cards = 90 cards.
So, Lloyd has 90 cards / 3 = <<90/3=30>>30 cards.
All three of them have 90 cards + 30 cards + 100 cards = <<90+30+100=215>>215 cards.
Thus, they need to collect 300 cards - 215 cards = <<300-215=85>>85 more cards.
#### 85

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 220, not 215. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
